intro: Schinus huigan var. dentata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree characterized by its compound leaves and small, bright red berries. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its botanical features include serrated leaf margins and a distinctive, aromatic scent. Schinus huigan var. dentata is part of the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants with similar chemical compositions and ecological roles.
